result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Hempel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation, including no further drug offenses.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation, including no further drug offenses.
Concurrent with: Ct. 1

Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation, including no further drug offenses.
Concurrent with: Cts. 1&2

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas J Hempel in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense req bond mod to remove GPS.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied.
ATTY Cafferty files motion for bond review.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas J Hempel in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Def req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod granted.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/his Atty, medical and treatment appointments. Defendant may also attend school for one expulsion hearing.   Make all court appearances on time.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 9-21-2015:  Defendant is to allowed to attend school at Case High School.**

**AMENDED 10-20-2015:  Defendant is allowed to search for work and if hired to attend work.  Defendant is also allowed to attend counseling and therapy.**
